checks.phrase: grace be to you
checks.phraseInfo: The word "you" refers to all the believers at Ephesus. (See: [[en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

checks.phrase: I urge you to live worthily of the calling
checks.phraseInfo: In all these verses the word "you" refers to all the believers at Ephesus. AT: "I encourage with you to conduct yourself in a manner proper of the calling" (See: [[en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

checks.phrase: May the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ be praised
checks.phraseInfo: This could be worded in the active form. AT: "Let us praise the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ" (See: [[en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

checks.phrase: To each one of us has been given a gift
checks.phraseInfo: AT: "A gift has been given to each believer" or "God gave a gift to each one of us" (See: [[en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

checks.phrase: has blessed us
checks.phraseInfo: This is an inclusive pronoun referring to Paul and all the believers at Ephesus. (See: [[en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])

checks.phrase: predestined us
checks.phraseInfo: Paul was including himself, the Ephesian church and all believers in Christ in his use of "us." (See: [[en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])

checks.phrase: we have redemption
checks.phraseInfo: "We" refers to all believers. (See: [[en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])

checks.phrase: come from us
checks.phraseInfo: The pronoun "us" refers to Paul and all the believers at Ephesus. (See: [[en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])

checks.phrase: divided us from each other
checks.phraseInfo: "Us" refers to both Paul and the Ephesians, that separated the Jewish believers from the Gentile believers. (See [[en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])

checks.phrase: For through Jesus we both have access
checks.phraseInfo: "We both" refers to both Paul, the believing Jews and the believing non-Jews. (See: [[en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])

checks.phrase: that we ask or think
checks.phraseInfo: "We" includes Paul and his audience. (See: [[en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])

checks.phrase: To each one of us
checks.phraseInfo: The word "us" includes Paul and all the believers at Ephesus. (See: [[en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])

checks.phrase: we are members of each other
checks.phraseInfo: AT: "we are all members of God's family" (See: [[en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])

checks.phrase: we are members of his body
checks.phraseInfo: The word "we" refers to Paul and all the believers. (See: [[en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])

checks.phrase: so we could be holy and blameless
checks.phraseInfo: Paul states two traits that we can become in God. (See: [[en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

checks.phrase: your trespasses and your sins
checks.phraseInfo: The words "trespasses" and "sins" mean basically the same thing. Paul uses them together to emphasize the greatness of the people's sin. (See: [[en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

checks.phrase: without stain or wrinkle
checks.phraseInfo: Paul speaks of the Church as a garment that is clean and in good condition. He uses the same idea in two ways to emphasize the Church's purity. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

checks.phrase: holy and without fault
checks.phraseInfo: The phrase "without fault" means basically the same thing as "holy." Paul uses the two together to emphasize the Church's purity. (See: [[en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

checks.phrase: were sealed with the promised Holy Spirit
checks.phraseInfo: As wax was placed on a letter and impressed with a symbol representing who sent the letter, God sealed our salvation with the Holy Spirit signifying his ownership of us. (See: [[en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

checks.phrase: And you were dead in your trespasses and your sins
checks.phraseInfo: This shows how sinful people are unable to obey God in the same way a dead person is unable to respond physically. (See: [[en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

checks.phrase: that you be rooted and grounded in his love
checks.phraseInfo: Paul compares their faith like a tree that has deep roots or a house build on a solid foundation. AT: "that you will be like a firmly rooted tree and a building founded upon stone" (See: [[en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

checks.phrase: one body
checks.phraseInfo: All believers in the family of God are like the various members of a human body. (See: [[en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

checks.phrase: for the building up of the body of Christ
checks.phraseInfo: This metaphor compares growing spiritually to doing exercises to increase the strength of the human body. (See: [[en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

checks.phrase: be like children
checks.phraseInfo: This is comparing a believer who has not grown spiritually to a child who has had very little experience in life. (See: [[en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

checks.phrase: tossed around and carried away by every wind of teaching
checks.phraseInfo: This metaphor compares a believer who has not become mature and hears wrong teaching to a boat that is being blown by the wind in random directions on the water. (See: [[en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

checks.phrase: he cleansed us by the washing of water by the word
checks.phraseInfo: Possible meanings are 1) Paul is referring to having been made clean by God's word and through water baptism in Christ or 2) Paul is saying God made us spiritually clean from our sins by the word of God like we make our bodies clean by washing with water. (See: [[en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

checks.phrase: we are members of his body
checks.phraseInfo: Possible meanings are 1) "we are members of his body of believers" (non-metaphorical sense) or 2) Believers fit together to form the body of Christ just as the parts of the human body fit together to form a person. (See: [[en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

checks.phrase: I have not stopped thanking God
checks.phraseInfo: This can be translated as a positive statement. AT: "I continue to thank God" (See: [[en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])

checks.phrase: that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened
checks.phraseInfo: The phrase "eyes of your heart" expresses one's ability to  gain understanding. AT: "that you may gain understanding and be enlightened" (See: [[en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

checks.phrase: seated him at his right hand
checks.phraseInfo: "seated Christ at God's right hand." This is the highest place of honor. (See: [[en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

checks.phrase: you once walked
checks.phraseInfo: This expresses the behavior of how people live. AT: "you once lived" (see [[en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

checks.phrase: For this I became a servant
checks.phraseInfo: AT: "I am now serving God to spread the gospel" (see [[en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

checks.phrase: access with confidence
checks.phraseInfo: AT: "access into God's presence with confidence" or "freedom to enter into God's presence with confidence" (See: [[en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

checks.phrase: For this cause
checks.phraseInfo: AT: "Because God has done all this for you" (See: [[en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

checks.phrase: Christ gave gifts like these
checks.phraseInfo: AT: "Christ gave gifts to the Church like these" (See: [[en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

checks.phrase: Tychicus
checks.phraseInfo: Tychicus was one of several men who served with Paul. (See: [[en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
